intro: Chamaesyce erythroclada, commonly known as the red-stemmed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. The bright red stems and yellow flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
